reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Enhancing Systems Towards Sustainable Universal Access

description.narrative: Eritrea - HIV - Ministry of Health of the State of Eritrea - MOH. This program has the following goals: To halt the transmission of HIV/STI infections nationwide. Improve the quality of life of people living with the disease. To contribute to attainment of health related SDGs. The objectives of this program are: Reduction of 50% in new infections among adults and children (Spectrum estimation 2016: from 451 in 2016 to less than 225 at the end of 2021). Reduction of 75% in AIDS related mortality (Spectrum estimation: From 439 in 2016 to less than 110 at the end of 2021)

title.narrative: Impact indicator for ERI-H-MOH
Number of AIDS-related deaths per 100,000 population
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
Percentage of other vulnerable populations (specify) who are living with HIV
Percentage of young people aged 15–24 who are living with HIV
Estimated percentage of children newly infected with HIV from mother-to-child transmission among women living with HIV delivering in the past 12 months
Coverage / Output indicator for ERI-H-MOH
Number of people who were tested for HIV and received their results during the reporting period
Percentage of HIV-positive registered TB patients given anti-retroviral therapy during TB treatment
Percentage of other vulnerable populations reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of people living with HIV newly initiated on ART who were screened for TB
KP OVP-other 1: Number and percentage of truck drivers reached with BCC outreach
Percentage of PLHIV on ART who initiated TB preventive therapy among those eligible during the reporting period
Percentage of people living with HIV newly enrolled in HIV care started on TB preventive therapy
Percentage of HIV-positive women who received ART during pregnancy and/or labour and delivery
Percentage of HIV-exposed infants receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth
KP SW-other 1: Number and percentage of female sex workers reached with BCC outreach
Percentage of TB patients who had an HIV test result recorded in the TB register
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of people living with HIV initiated on ART who are screened for TB in HIV treatment settings
Percentage of HIV-positive pregnant women who received antiretrovirals to reduce the risk of mother-to-child transmission
Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy
Percentage of pregnant women who know their HIV status

dimension.name: HIV test status
dimension.value: Known positive HIV infection at ANC

title.narrative: Percentage of antenatal care attendees tested for syphilis
Number of women and men aged 15+ who received an HIV test and know their results
Percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of infants born to HIV-positive women receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth
Percentage of other vulnerable populations that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
M&E-other 1: Number of health facilites that received integrated supportive supervision in the last six months based on the MOH ISS guidelines
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Outcome indicator for ERI-H-MOH
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART who are virologically suppressed
Percentage of sex workers who avoid health care because of stigma and discrimination
Percentage of women and men aged 15–49 who report discriminatory attitudes towards people living with HIV

Percentage of people living with HIV not on ART at the end of the reporting period among people living with HIV who were either on ART at the end of the last reporting period or newly initiated on ART during the reporting period
Percentage of people living with HIV who know their HIV status at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client
Percentage of (estimated) people living with HIV who have been tested HIV-positive
Percentage of women and men aged 15-49 who had more than one partner in the past 12 months who used a condom during their last sexual intercourse
Percentage of adults and children with HIV, known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
Percentage of women attending antenatal care
